page.title: 03VILLAGE LIFE
page.content:
The area as a whole is sparsely populated, the population being employed either locally; the farms employing mostly their own family units, or in the nearby towns.
Many of the farms and barns have been converted to homes for businessmen and their families who commute. The vast majority of people in the area own their own transport.
There are no shops so a butcher's van, a travelling fish salesman and several gocers' vans cover the area; the bulk of food shoping is carried out in the nearby towns.
The area is on the edge of the Ribble Valley which is currently being promoted as a tourist area.
